sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A discourse concerning the devotions of the Church of Rome, especially, as compared with those of the Church of England in which it is shewn, that whatever the Romanists pretend, there is not so true devotion among them, nor such rational provision for it, nor encouragement to it, as in the church established by law among us. Stanley, William, 1647-1731.
[2], 67 p.
Printed by Benj. Tooke ..., London : 1685.
Reproduction of original in Union Theological Seminary Library, New York. Attributed to William Stanley. cf. NUC pre-1956.
=======

Stanley, William, 1647-1731.
[2], 67 p.
Printed by Benj. Tooke ..., London : 1685.
Reproduction of original in Union Theological Seminary Library, New York. Attributed to William Stanley. cf. NUC pre-1956.
